value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. value.title: Customer Retention in Power BI   DAX Measures
value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business. value.title: Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI with NOT IN or NOT EQUAL Rule

value.title: Export the Data of a Power BI table entirely in a few Clicks

value.title: How to Create a Date or Calendar Table and Dimension in Power BI using Power Query

value.title: How to Use Time and Date Dimensions in a Power BI Model

However, I got some questions in the comments about how they will be used together in a data model. In this video, I’ll explain that. value.title: Left Outer Join   What it is and how to use it in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: Merging two tables is one of the fundamental operations in any BI or database system. In this video, you will learn what is LEFT JOIN and how you can apply it using Power Query and Power BI.
